																									Winnipeg launches online tool in advance of summer transit overhaul
annotations.reason: This is a video timestamp and title, not a paragraph contributing to the article's core story.

annotations.paragraph: Winnipeg is less than two months away from a complete overhaul of its transit system, which will include changes to nearly every bus route.
annotations.reason: This provides essential context about the upcoming transit system changes.

annotations.paragraph: To help prepare riders for the June 29 launch of the new system, the city announced a new online tool Thursday that will show people how their trips will change this summer.
annotations.reason: This paragraph introduces the main subject of the article, the new online tool.

annotations.paragraph: Coun. Sherri Rollins said she hopes that seeing the routes in advance will help make the transition easier for transit users.
annotations.reason: This quote provides direct commentary from a city official about the tool's intended impact.

annotations.paragraph: “I think all the information we’re offering today, all the training, will help demystify the situation,” she said.
annotations.reason: This quote is vague and does not provide specific information about the transit overhaul.

annotations.reason: This is an unrelated promotional message for Toronto news alerts.

annotations.paragraph: In addition to offering a glimpse of the new routes, the tool shows how long passengers will have to wait for a bus and any connections they’ll need to make under the new system.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the features of the new online tool.

annotations.paragraph: Mayor Scott Gillingham said it’ll take time for bus riders to adjust — but that the change will be worth it.
